verses.verse: The words<WH1697> of the Preacher,<WH6953> the son<WH1121> of David,<WH1732> king<WH4428> in Jerusalem.<WH3389>
"Vanity<WH1892> of vanities,<WH1892>" says<WH559> the Preacher,<WH6953> "Vanity<WH1892> of vanities!<WH1892> All<WH3605> is vanity.<WH1892>"
What<WH4100> advantage<WH3504> does man<WH120> have in all<WH3605> his work<WH5999> Which<WH7945> he does<WH5998> under<WH8478> the sun<WH8121>?
A generation<WH1755> goes<WH1980> and a generation<WH1755> comes,<WH935> But the earth<WH776> remains<WH5975> forever.<WH5769>
Also, the sun<WH8121> rises<WH2224> and the sun<WH8121> sets;<WH935> And hastening<WH7602> to its place<WH4725> it rises<WH2224> there<WH8033> [again.]

Blowing<WH1980> toward<WH413> the south,<WH1864> Then turning<WH5437> toward<WH413> the north,<WH6828> The wind<WH7307> continues<WH1980> swirling<WH5437> along;<WH1980> And on its circular<WH5439> courses<WH5439> the wind<WH7307> returns.<WH7725>

All<WH3605> the rivers<WH5158> flow<WH1980> into the sea,<WH3220> Yet the sea<WH3220> is not full.<WH4392> To the place<WH4725> where<WH7945> the rivers<WH5158> flow,<WH1980> There<WH8033> they flow<WH1980> again.<WH7725>

All<WH3605> things<WH1697> are wearisome;<WH3023> Man<WH376> is not able<WH3201> to tell<WH1696> [it.] The eye<WH5869> is not satisfied<WH7646> with seeing,<WH7200> Nor<WH3808> is the ear<WH241> filled<WH4390> with hearing.<WH8085>

That which<WH4100> <WH7945> has been<WH1961> is that which<WH7945> will be, And that which<WH4100> <WH7945> has been done<WH6213> is that which<WH7945> will be done.<WH6213> So, there<WH369> is nothing<WH369> <WH3605> new<WH2319> under<WH8478> the sun.<WH8121>

Is there<WH3426> anything<WH1697> of which<WH7945> one might say,<WH559> "See<WH7200> this,<WH2088> it is new<WH2319>"? Already<WH3528> it has existed<WH1961> for ages<WH5769> Which<WH834> were before<WH4480> <WH6440> us.

There<WH369> is no<WH369> remembrance<WH2146> of earlier<WH7223> things;<WH7223> And also<WH1571> of the later<WH314> things<WH314> which<WH7945> will occur,<WH1961> There will be for them no<WH3808> remembrance<WH2146> Among<WH5973> those who<WH7945> will come<WH1961> later<WH314> [still.]
I, the Preacher,<WH6953> have been<WH1961> king<WH4428> over<WH5921> Israel<WH3478> in Jerusalem.<WH3389>

And I set<WH5414> my mind<WH3820> to seek<WH1875> and explore<WH8446> by wisdom<WH2451> concerning<WH5921> all<WH3605> that has been done<WH6213> under<WH8478> heaven.<WH8064> [It] is a grievous<WH7451> task<WH6045> [which] God<WH430> has given<WH5414> to the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120> to be afflicted<WH9419> with.

I have seen<WH7200> all<WH3605> the works<WH4639> which<WH7945> have been done<WH6213> under<WH8478> the sun,<WH8121> and behold,<WH2009> all<WH3605> is vanity<WH1892> and striving<WH7469> after wind.<WH7307>
What is crooked<WH5791> cannot<WH3201> <WH3808> be straightened,<WH8626> and what<WH2642> is lacking<WH2642> cannot<WH3201> <WH3808> be counted.<WH4487>

I said<WH1696> to myself,<WH3820> "Behold,<WH2009> I have magnified<WH1431> and increased<WH3254> wisdom<WH2451> more<WH5921> than<WH5921> all<WH3605> who<WH834> were over<WH5921> Jerusalem<WH3389> before<WH6440> me; and my mind<WH3820> has observed<WH7200> a wealth<WH7235> of wisdom<WH2451> and knowledge.<WH1847>"

And I set<WH5414> my mind<WH3820> to know<WH3045> wisdom<WH2451> and to know<WH3045> madness<WH1947> and folly;<WH5531> I realized<WH3045> that this<WH2088> also<WH1571> is striving<WH7475> after wind.<WH7307>
Because<WH3588> in much<WH7230> wisdom<WH2451> there is much<WH7230> grief,<WH3708> and increasing<WH3254> knowledge<WH1847> [results in] increasing<WH3254> pain.<WH4341>
